Why RSS isn't Mainstream

What is it Missing?

~1 minute read from Dec 26th 2021

RSS is an amazing tool for staying up to date across thousands of websites, but something mission critical is missing. There simply isnâ€™t anything to that will recommend new feeds. This makes building up your feed list a hastle, especially if websites donâ€™t list their feed urls anywhere. As Iâ€™ve continued to use RSS, I see an increase in itâ€™s value as a tool to create a more decentralized and safer internet.

We need a Spotify, Pandora, or a Facebook for but just for RSS and without the creepy tracking/cyber-stalking. Just a simple website with a recommendation engine built off of other peopleâ€™s feeds. A good feature on top of the recommendation would be to have a public profile on the site, that you can link your friends to with feeds you recommend to others.

Assuming basic security and encryption practices are put in place, I think this idea has a ton of promise to help a lot of people without being bloated or a menace to privacy. For additional privacy, the website could allow users to choose which feeds to enable as publicly recommended.

Honestly, since the idea isnâ€™t crazy big, and if this doesnâ€™t already exist, I think Iâ€™ll take a stab at trying to make this eventually.

If you also want to see this happen or if you know of a website that already does this, please contact me.
